intro: Valeriana pseudodubia, commonly known as the false valerian, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, often fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. The flowers are usually small, clustered in umbels, and range in color from white to pinkish.
